Azerbaijan has further developed due to the potential created by the economic diversification in the world during the economic crisis.
Industry, agriculture, tourism, information and communication technologies are key areas of economic development in Azerbaijan.
There is a modern and developed tourism infrastructure in the capital city of Baku and in the capital of Azerbaijan.
l European Games has had a very positive impact on tourism development in Azerbaijan.
Issues related to food security in Azerbaijan are successfully resolved.
In the first half of 2015, Azerbaijan's economy has grown by 6 percent and agriculture has grown by more than 7 percent.
The growth of the non-oil sector of Azerbaijan's economy was more than 9 percent.
Implementation of social and infrastructural projects throughout the country continues.

The ministers @aldorebelo and Izabella Teixeira reported hj the second lowest rate of illegal deforestation in # AmazôniaLegal of the historical series.
With the 15% reduction between 2013 and 2014, deforestation in # AmazôniaLegal has fallen by 82% in the last ten years.
For a continental country like Brazil, a reduction target is very important, and we will arrive at zero illegal deforestation in # AmazôniaLegal.
This is + a step in our commitment to preserving the environment and reforesting degraded areas.
